intro: Gnaphalium standleyi, commonly known as the Mexican everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish to white flowers that are typically clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Gnaphalium standleyi is also known for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
